definition: to remember/to bear in mind/to learn by heart
to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: I just wanted to write down everything the professor said and memorize it.
sentences.chinese: 我就是把教授讲的话原原本本纪录下来然后记住。

sentences.english: That teacher told my sister , don't learn much more English!
sentences.chinese: 记住不要再像我妹妹一样被一些居心叵测的人利用。

sentences.english: Remember to carry out your promise.
Also remember that one size does not fit all when optimizing pages.
sentences.chinese: 还要记住，在对页面进行优化时不要千篇一律。

sentences.english: Remember that rho is the distance from the origin.
Bear in mind, however, that these tests were based on simulated user workloads.
sentences.chinese: 但是请记住，这些测试是以模拟的用户负载为基础的。

sentences.english: Automagically remembers relevant settings for different locations.
sentences.chinese: 自动记住对不同位置的相关设定。

sentences.english: Keep in mind that is bad is not abandoned.
sentences.chinese: 要记住，被抛弃的并不一定就是不好的。

sentences.english: Try making up the words to one of your favorite songs, and sing it out loud.
sentences.chinese: 记住你最喜欢的歌的歌词，并大声的唱出来。

sentences.english: Remember that these conversions are for display only.
sentences.chinese: 记住这些转换仅用于显示。

sentences.english: Keep in mind, jealousy may pop up when you least expect it.
sentences.chinese: 记住，嫉妒感会在你最意想不到的时候窜出来。

sentences.english: Remember, the people who are at the top are nothing but practical.
sentences.chinese: 记住，位于顶端的人们，是实际工作能力很强的人。

sentences.english: You can remember my telephone number if you write it down.
sentences.chinese: 如果你写下我的电话号，你就会记住它。
记住，观点是带主观性的。

sentences.english: She worked tirelessly and had the knack of remembering everyone's name.
sentences.chinese: 她不知疲倦的工作，而且能够记住每个人的名字。

sentences.english: Remember that thou keep holy the sabbath day.
sentences.chinese: 应记住安息日，守为圣日。

definition: to take note of/to pay attention to
to know/to become aware of/also pr. [zhi1 dao5]
best/(you) had better (do what we suggest)
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
